caption: It’s ok. Food just never ready on time
Great quality.  Decent prices.

Ordered a paneer tikka masala and a naan for delivery from doordash. Even though I asked for extra spicy, the curry was very sweet, too oily and not the right flavors. The paneer was very tight and not tender at all.
Good food, friendly people

I never write reviews for restaurants but I love this place so much lol. I've ordered here at least once a month (but usually more than that) since they opened, and everything is consistently awesome. Nothing is ever watery or bland. Their chutneys are so good, their garlic naan perfect, and all of their vegetarian appetizers and entrees are amazing. I usually get yellow daal, malai kofta, daal saag, or saag paneer for my meal. They always include a little container of kheer (rice pudding), and everyone there is super nice. Best Indian food restaurant in Brooklyn!

This place has 4.8 stars for a reason!!! As an Indian from NJ, I’ve tried many restaurants in Brooklyn hoping to find great quality Indian takeout. After my meal tonight, I believe I’ve found it. Definitely a bit of an expense, would love to see a dinner or lunch special (sorry if I didn’t see one and they are available options). However it’s worth every penny. Delivery was early. Ordered the Chettinad (non creamy & spicy) and the chicken was succulent and soft. Reminded me of my dad’s homemade curry! The Garlic Naan was buttery and delicious and a great size for one person to have some leftovers, although I definitely ate the whole thing in one sitting. The Raita (god, why is it so hard to find good raita in this city?!) was perfect. We also got the chicken tikka which was not spicy and a bit sweet (but my roommates loved it). You can consider this my love letter to Indika House. Looking forward to ordering here again.
Everything was so delicious. My new favorite restaurant. Good portions and food that was fresh and quality. Can't wait to order from this place again.

I give them the FOUR F's...Fresh, Fast & Full of Flavor. My fist time eating authentic Indian cuisine and they set the bar high. The receptionist was very helpful too cudos to him 👍Soo happy it's close to me I loved everythinggg but that Lamb is where it's at tho!!
Best Indian food I’ve had in NYC!
(Translated by Google) Very fast service  (Original) Muy rapido el servicio
Good service for the costumer
I've lived in the neighborhood since before there were Indian restaurants here and this is by far the best. The shrimp masala is great and their customer service is always friendly. It's my go-to.
Best indian food around here by far
Amazing value and amazing food!
Yum, yum, yum!!!

Legit, this place possibly makes the best Indian food anywhere in NYC and one of the best in the country, so rich, flavorful, authentic, fresh and aromatic. I tried most of their dishes and spices, and their food doesn't get any better than that. The prices are great and the portions are huge. Thank you for your outstanding service.
Best indian food around and we'll kept up given the area.

Best and excellent food all the dishes are absolutely delicious service is superb  and the owner is Mr Sagheer he is so friendly. WE  recommend  this place best Indian food in Brooklyn  God bless  them

Decent Indian food but very mild and a little overcooked and geared for American taste buds. The marssel leaves potatoes were interesting in a good way (a little like persian khorsht sabzi, sweet and sour green sauce) and the dahls and veg curry were sort of standard, but a little underwhelming. Veg samosas were also pretty solid.
The food is really good. We enjoyed it a lot. Will come back again to order more
SO GOOD. Best Indian food I’ve had in the city. Order any random item off the menu and it’ll blow your mind

Sorry, but no. Was excited to try this place based on all the reviews. I will not order here again.  Not sure if these other people have eaten at other Indian restaurants, but this place is disappointing.  The only good thing is the Naan.  It's solid. A nice fluffy naan. I'll give it that.  Other things we ordered Veg samosa, just ok, kind of mushy inside  Aloo gobi: watery and just flavor of chili powder, even tho we ordered mild  Yellow dal: watery and just flavor of chili powder, spicy even tho I ordered mild  Chicken tikka masala: yes white meat, but doesn't seem like tandoori chicken. Again, sauce watery and not flavorful at all.  Lamb Josh: kind of ok I guess, not really much flavor  Rice: ok, normal basmati  Overall everything is just watery! It all lacks the complex flavors of Indian spices and all you taste is chili powder.  I wouldn't order from here again.

Really yummy and great service! I would be back. We ordered the gambas, baked Brie, the salmon, and the short rib. Everything was unique and well prepared. They also have an open and comfortable outside patio
absolutely bad 😂

Ordered the $18 special with 1 app, entree and naan. Got the chicken tikka appetizer with malai kofta and potato chaat with chicken tikka masala. Everything is really good but the tikka masala is deff a favourite. I asked for spicy and it still wasn’t so next time I’ll make sure to note extra spicy.  Foods flavour is really good. Probably the best I’ve had in Brooklyn so far. Even the green chutney was good doesn’t have the usual fake green colour and weird watering taste.

This is easily some of the best and most delicious Indian food I have ever eaten on the East Coast. I’ve always been disappointed by Indian food in New York but after Indika House I think I’ve found the perfect Indian Restaurant where almost every single thing we’ve ordered has been finger licking good! Everything from the Lamb Biryani to the Mango Lassi to the Chefs Special Lamb Curry and the Kababs are delicious. You can’t go wrong with this place. Must try!
Delicious Food! Amazing, fast service! The firebird is my absolute favorite. Can't go wrong at Indika House.

I made our purchase based on the reviews I saw on Google maps!  The individual who wrote these excellent reviews must be related to owner.  The only thing we liked was the shrimps 🍤 in the Briyani.  The soup was not my cup of tea. The Naan ( my guest favored  that). Not me. The rice was to much  Not what I expected at all. I was looking for a taste similar to that of Arga Heights  before the good Chef left.  When we ate the rice all i could taste was cloves and cardamom seeds.  I tried using the condiments that where sent to enhance the flavors but it did not work.  Except for the shrimps! The shrimps in the  Briyani was well seasoned despite the fact that the rice had an overwhelmingly strong clove taste.

This restaurant is the one I always prefer. I eat in many restaurants but to this one I go the most. The team is very affectionate and the food they cook is so delicious. I would always prefer to have a decent dinner in this restaurant. Highly recommended.

Oh my goodness! I have never had Indian food that tasted so good. There are no words to describe the taste and flavour of this food. Sag paneer is my favourite Indian dish and when I tasted this, the flavour and taste just blew me away. It was so green and thick and rich. My compliments to the chef. Excellent!
Best Indian I have had I think.
This place is great. Each dish is the best varient I have ever had in Brooklyn.

Amazing. Best Indian food I've had in a very long time, and I eat Indian food all the time!. You literally can't go wrong with anything you order. I got vegetarian food this time but my chicken was soooo juicy last time. The owner is also very personable -- he remembered my order from the last time I came in 3 weeks prior. I can't wait to go back!!!
Wow!!! I’ve tried a lot of Indian places in Brooklyn and I this one was hands down the best
This place is the best for Indian take out in the area for sure! The employees are super friendly and the food is delicious!

I never write reviews but something about this place is making me go out of my way to actually leave feedback for once. First of all, even though we are in the midst of Covid-19, if you live in this neighborhood, take your time to go here and do a pick up order. It's a shame we can't do indoor eats right now because the look of this place is so progressive, niche and being overlooked by everyone. If you know anything about Brooklyn culture, this place is 100% representative as to what that is; the walls are filled with extensive and breathtaking murals, the fixtures are rustic yet modern and even the furnishing is genuine to Indian culture. The food is full of flavor and authentic beyond a doubt. I've ordered about 10 dishes from here now and I have never been dissapointed. Nothing tastes generic or like any other restaurant.  Each dish has it's own specific flavor, which I promise you, rivals on your previous favorite version of it from any other place, maybe even your mother's kitchen! Finally, the staff is so friendly and super accommodating. I walked in and talked to the owner and felt like I was talking to a friend. At the end of our conversation, he gave me a voucher for a discount next time I eat there, you can tell he really cares about his clients and business; it's always a pleasure to support hard working, honest people and the local small business owner. This restaurant has only been open for a few months now and is already my favorite Indian spot in the whole city. Try it and you'll understand why.
I ordered the lunch special today and it was delicious. Very flavorful!

Got take out and was super impressed! Everything was delicious, well seasoned and packaged impeccably. Would definitely recommend!  Edit: been ordering regularly from here for the last 4 months, the food is as amazing as ever and is delivered perfectly. Never had a bad experience at Indika. Also that lamb biriyani is bomb. You guys rock!

Amazing Indian restaurant! We’ve ordered multiple times and the food is always delicious. The chicken korma is some of the best I’ve ever had, the garlic naan is super tasty, and the service while picking up has always been great.

We’ve ordered from this place twice now, and both times have truly been excellent. The first time we ordered, I completely messed up the order. When I called the restaurant to fix the order, the man on the phone was friendly and helpful (I’m sorry I didn’t get your name!). The orders have arrived quickly and exactly as requested. I can’t recommend this place enough. We can vouch that the palak paneer, paneer tikka masala, naan, and goat house special are all delicious. Will absolutely be ordering again!

I was honestly very skeptical at seeing all 5 star reviews, however this food may well be the best Indian food I can find in Brooklyn. We had an order for pick up. The people working are super friendly and above all else, the food is delicious. It’s extremely well seasoned and cooked to perfection. I’ve had so many disappointing Indian take outs and I’m so happy to have finally found this place. Totally worth stopping by or getting delivery!
I had a great  in this place. We loved the wonderful atmosphere and the meals. The waiters are super amiable. I am glad we finally decided to eat here.
Ordered delivery. Have a new go-to Indian spot. So good! :)
Ordered multiple times through Seamless. Fast delivery, great food. The paneer is so tasty and we also loved the samosas! So happy to have found this place!
Have only ordered their delivery, but it is soooooo good. I can’t wait to eat at the restaurant once quarantine is over. The food is so fresh and some of the best Indian I’ve ever had.

Had a hankering for Indian, and saw this new place near my apartment with great reviews. I got the Lamb Vindaloo which was delicious and the chicken 65 which I now need the recipe for that sauce. Can't wait to try their Indo-China cuisine.
My go-to for Indian/Indo-Chinese! Great veggie options, would especially recommend the spicy cauliflower (it's AMAZING) and the matar paneer👌

Editing my review to 5 stars. I’ve been to Indika House since they opened, but wow their food recently is just mind blowing! Maybe they hired a new chef or something, but whatever it is, please keep doing it!
Never change Indika House <3
Day 2 of quarantine , and just enjoyed amazing delicious indian food from these guys
Absolutely delicious. I inhaled the Aloo Chana Saag. If you want Indian and you’re near Myrtle-Broadway, this is a must. Mandatory.
Nice food and nice service
Love this place, very nice service and the food is delicious - especially the garlic naan. We have been in Brooklyn for 6 days and ate three times and this place because we loved it so much!
Absolutely delicious, and the service was wonderful.  The restaurant is bright and clean.  Highly highly recommend.
Amazing food , hospitality , great music , super clean. Best Indian in bushwick

(Translated by Google) Very good Indian restaurant, there was free and dessert, as well as the water service excellent! Can only recommend the Butter Chicken and Naan!  (Original) Sehr gutes indisches Restaurant, Vor- und Nachspeise gab es kostenlos dazu, genauso das Wasser - Service hervorragend! Kann das Butter Chicken und Naan nur empfehlen!

Found this restaurant randomly on yelp and wasn't disappointed. The naan was delicious and saag was awesome. My girlfriend bad the vegetarian curry which was very good also. The people working here are very nice and the prices are very fair. Would totally recommend this place and come back
super comfy place with such wonderfully sweet staff and the food is killer. highly recommend.
Best Indian in Brooklyn!
Excellent,, and the food was delicious...
Amazing Indian spot conveniently right off of Myrtle Broadway. Would recommend the butter chicken.
Amazing food. Wonderful service. We’ll be back for sure!

Best Indian food I’ve tried in Brooklyn. It will definitely be my new go to spot. The food was high quality, great flavors, and good prices. I tried the chicken korma and the butter chicken.  The service was really attentive. I also want to note that it’s a family owned business and it shows in how much they care about their food and how they treat their customers.

Impressed with how good it was! Tried for the first time and the delivery was faster than expected. Everything I ordered was delicious and the Ingredients tasted fresher than the other options in the area. Don’t change! We’ll be coming back for more 😆😋
I routinely order from here and also eat-in and recommend both. The food is fresh and flavorful. The menu is also interesting and has a wide variety of dishes.
So good

Wow! Yo!! For real? Please make sure you order their daal-palaak ka shorba! It's a hunter green soup that taste so good you'll want to rub into the bruises you might have on your body. The sauces here are out of THIS world. I got the butter chicken and it was luscious and sufficient. The mural work at this place feels like you're engaging in a sensual ceremony that activates all your pleasure zones. Make sure you close it with the deconstructed carrot cake - I forgot the name but they'll know what I'm talking about. Tell'em Lou sent ya!

Lamb chops were amazing! Great seasoning. Garlic naan addictive and tasty. Service staff is kind, friendly and just the right amount of service to not over crowd or forget you. Free desert for clearing some young trouble makers and the owner was the sweetest when he didn’t have to be. Only Indian restaurant I’ll eat at in bed study. Much love and future success to this wonderful addition to the neighborhood.
Amazing customer service! Everything was delicious and very well prepared! The presentation was outstanding!!! We will be returning very soon! This is now our go-to Indian restaurant!!!

Brand new place in the neighborhood right by the Myrtle Broadway JMZ stop. Very happy with the food, service and atmosphere. The owners are very nice and have really paid attention to the details. Hope the place sticks around!
Tasty! Lunch special until 3, great deal. Plus the mural is super dope.
The butter chicken is bangin, the garlic naan and mango lassi were delicious. very friendly staff, they gave me a small bowl of kheer (rice pudding) on the house.
This place is AMAZING! Everything I’ve tried has been super delicious and the staff is lovely.

This new spot is great! I had samosa chat, the food was vibrating with energy from all the flavor it had and was also very fresh. Even the presentation for a takeout was a stunning piece of art! Highly recommended with great prices too 👍😋

I was blown away by the decor and amazing hospitality by the staff. Living in Brooklyn, I always craved authentic Indian food. I tried many places around the city, but Indika House is truly a hidden gem! If you are in the area be sure to check them out! And best of all delivery is a charm! Will be definitely coming back for more!

Really wonderful food. The lunch special was a great deal and the Chicken Tikka Masala was very flavorful. The ambiance was also lovely and the kheer was the best that I've had in years. The best Indian food around by far. Thanks for the lovely lunch, we will be back frequently.
Excellent food and friendly service!
Great food amazing service
Been a here a few times since inception . The food is great, staff is friendly and service is awesome. The chicken tikka masala is amazing
Food is incredible! Had the lamb biryani, and it  tasted just like my mom’s homemade food😋 truly authentic desi food, with real rich flavors and great portions. Must try!
Absolutely amazing! Wonderful service and friendly people. I got the chicken Lollipop and was amazing.Best Indian restaurant
Nice environment.The food was delicious, Yummy and great prices. There service was excellent. Definitely we coming back.
Delicious food! Will be coming regularly now! Thanks for the great service. 5 stars!

Excellent food, decor, and service. This place just recently opened up and honestly they definitely know what they are doing. A much needed addition to the neighborhood. The food is fresh, well prepared and has great flavor.

Probably the best Indian spot in the neighborhood. Portions are huge and service was attentive. Guy that served us seemed genuinely appreciative of our business.  Loved that they had chili garlic naan.  Garlic cauliflower was on sweeter side but so good and different. Chicken gassi sauce was great, chicken was a bit dry. Saag paneer was really great.  Menu is HUGE and a bit overwhelming but excited to come back and try their other dishes.
The food was amazing and the service was even better. It's rare to find great Indian food, but here is a nice gem.

They have a home made spicy onion condiment, it was so good I hardly touched the tamarind sauce which is always a must and one of my favorite flavors. The chicken tikka masala was a good portion and the curry had a good amount of flavor. The garlic naan looks made fresh and is better than those in many other restaurants I’ve visited. Would definitely recommend for dinner as well as for lunch when they have discounted rate.

This is the best Indian restaurant in this neighborhood. Their service and the food is amazing. The garlic naan, butter chicken, and the mango lassi is awesome. The staffs are very friendly also. Love their art work.
I grew up eating my mom and grandmother’s Indian food and was always disappointed by the Indian options around Bushwick until Indika House opened. Best Indian food restaurant around!!

Must give this restaurant a try because everything is on point! The portions are large compared to the low price. Customer service and food is amazing! Very cozy and casual atmosphere. Definitely come try if you’re in the area 👍 10/10
Awesome food & venue! The service was great- very welcoming, attentive, and helpful with menu. The food was delicious and I look forward to revisiting soon.
Love this restaurant! The Owner and wait staff were so nice! The food was delicious and that was my first time I ate Indian food.  I can't wait to go back there again.
Delicious. Portions are generous. The owner is very nice. The cauliflower appetizer and vegetarian entrees (mushroom saag, paneer tikka masala) were great
Food was amazing. Just had a quick lunch and it was more than satisfying. I highly recommend this place for Indian food fanatics.
Myrtle broadway's best indian food!
Amazing food!! Need to dim the lights in the dining room to create a bit of ambiance.
Great experience! Lovely venue! Food is authentic and tastes superb! Fresh garlic naan and chicken tikka masala are my favorite! Must see spectacular indoor  artwork!!
Great authentic, home cooked-feel meals.  Fun decor, flavorful dishes.  I had saag and lamb...highly recommend.
Delicious food! Loved their butter chicken, naan bread was super tender and fresh. Nice place to sit down too
We ordered Naan and butter chicken and food was super delicious and service was amazing.
Absolutely amazing! Wonderful service and friendly people. Delicious food and naan. Love the artwork inside. Please come try!
Just had the first of many meals here. I got the lamb curry and it was amazing. Super good garlic naan too.
